body.p:
Leitchfield Grayson Co. Ky.
May 19th 1863
To his Excellency James F Robbinson
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that James H. Hays of the county & state aforesaid was at this term of the Grayson circuit court fined twenty dollars under an indictment charging him with adultery with a Miss Jane Nichols

He is a soldier in the United States army he belongs to company C, of the 17th Regiment of Ky. volunteers and has fought bravely through the battles of Fort Donaldson and Shiloh and is now at home on furlough sick & reports himself regularly to his regiment & expects to return as soon as his health will permit -- He has been prosecuted very violently by secesh alone maliciously on account of his being a federal soldier & we think under the circumstances that his case deserves the clemency of the governor especially as he is a very poor man and has a wife and four small children depending upon him for support. If you can release him of the fine you will confer a favor upon your petitioners
